metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6446 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: ** DISPUTED **   An issue was discovered in NumPy 1.16.0 and earlier. It uses the pickle Python module unsafely, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted serialized object, as demonstrated by a numpy.load call. NOTE: third parties dispute this issue because it is  a behavior that might have legitimate applications in (for example)  loading serialized Python object arrays from trusted and authenticated  sources.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> The following commit added an option that will allow disabling the use of pickles in load and save operations: https://github.com/numpy/numpy/commit/a2bd3a7eabfe053d6d16a2130fdcad9e5211f6bb  That commit is included in xenial+  Marking this as low priority due to the limited reverse-depends in main, and the fact that it may not be possible to switch the default to false in stable releases without breaking use-cases.

criterions.comment: python-numpy package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
